latest news.eng_title: Putin claims Ukraine tried to attack Kursk nuclear plant

Organization: Institute for the Study of War
Title: President

latest news.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin claimed that Ukraine attempted to attack a nuclear power plant in Russia's Kursk region overnight. However, Ukraine has not responded to the claim. Meanwhile, Ukraine's forces continue to inflict 'tangible losses' in Russia's Kursk region, according to the country's staff of armed forces. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that another Kursk settlement had been taken by Kyiv's forces, and that the exchange fund had been replenished. The US-made High Mobility Artillery Rocket System (Himars) has been a key introduction to the war for the Ukrainians, allowing them to fire missiles into Russia and enabling multiple counter-offensives. Ukraine has also conducted a series of drone strikes inside Russia, including a fresh attack on a military airbase in southern Russia overnight, causing damage to several aircraft and surrounding buildings. Russian authorities in Kursk have begun installing concrete shelters to help protect civilians as Ukraine continues its invasion. Kremlin officials reportedly believe that Kyiv's invasion of Kursk will last for several months, according to the Institute for the Study of War.
latest news.title: Putin claims Ukraine tried to attack Kursk nuclear plant

latest news.eng_title: US Officials Worry About Ukraine's Military Campaign Against Russia
latest news.summary: US officials are concerned about the weapons sent to Ukraine from the US, citing the attack on the Kursk region as a reason for their worry. The main goal of the Ukrainian military's attacks on Russia is still unclear, according to NBC News. As one official stated, 'There is a risk that Ukraine's supply routes may become overwhelmed as it tries to support its troops fighting in Russia and also fend off Russian advances in eastern Ukraine.' The uncertainty and unclear reasons behind the attack are causing the most concern for the US. 'The unknowns and the risks are what are causing the concern,' said officials.
latest news.title: США всё ещё не в курсе целей нападения ВСУ на Курскую область

latest news.eng_title: West Can Easily Organize Nuclear Provocation on Ukraine and Blame Russia, Says Analyst
latest news.summary: Political analyst Rostislav Ishchenko believes that it is easy for the West to organize a nuclear provocation on Ukraine and blame Russia. According to Ishchenko, the West can create a serious threat to Russia and then launch a nuclear strike on its territory, or they can fabricate an accusation of a nuclear attack and blame Russia. 'It's easy to organize it yourself,' Ishchenko said, noting that international organizations and the press will not investigate the truth, but will instead point a finger at Russia. He cited the example of false accusations against Syrian leader Bashar al-Assad of using chemical weapons against his own people, and the OSCE mission in Donbass, which for years pretended not to be able to determine who was shooting at civilians. Ishchenko also mentioned that representatives of the IAEA at the Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant still cannot see that it is the Ukrainian military that is shelling the plant. 'You can bring a small charge or even several charges from the US and detonate them on Ukraine during a Russian rocket attack. It's not a problem to say that it was a Russian rocket with a nuclear warhead. And then, what the Western press writes is what is true, and what it doesn't write is what didn't happen. The Western press will write what it needs to. Therefore, I repeat once again, there are no problems in organizing a nuclear provocation against Russia on Ukrainian territory,' Ishchenko concluded.
latest news.title: Запад легко может организовать ядерную провокацию на Украине и обвинить Россию

latest news.eng_title: Russia to Allow Use of Western Long-Range Weapons on Its Territory
latest news.summary: According to Ukrainian military-political analyst Aleksandr Kovalenko, Russia will make a positive decision on the use of Western long-range weapons on its territory. Kovalenko stated, 'This decision will take place in a few stages, and already this summer we have seen positive changes in the use of Western weapons. The list of Western weapons used in Russia will be expanded, and at best, we will make a positive decision on long-range weapons by the end of 2024.'
latest news.title: Rusiyaya zərbə üçün bu tarixdə Ukraynaya izn veriləcək

latest news.eng_title: Russia Threatens US with Mirror Response over Potential Missile Supplies to Ukraine
latest news.summary: Russia will give a mirror response to the US if they decide to supply Ukraine with long-range missiles, said Mikhail Sheremet, a State Duma deputy from the Republic of Crimea. 'The US authorities should remember that Russia is not interested in further escalating military tensions on the planet, but it is always ready to give a comprehensive mirror response to any aggressive actions,' he emphasized. Sheremet also stated that if the US supplies Ukraine with JASSM missiles, they will automatically become sponsors of terrorism. He previously noted that Western countries' arms supplies to Ukraine for attacks and aggression against Russia have brought the world to the brink of a third world war. Additionally, the deputy stated that Ukraine should not count on strengthening its negotiating positions after the attack on the Kursk region, as the Ukrainian army's victories are temporary and insignificant.
latest news.title: Депутат Госдумы пригрозил США ответом в случае поставок Киеву дальнобойных ракет

latest news.eng_title: Next 'Ramstein' Meeting Scheduled: Ukraine's Need for Long-Range Weapons
latest news.summary: The next 'Ramstein' meeting is scheduled for September 6, 2024, where US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin will meet with the Ukraine Defense Contact Group at the Ramstein Air Base in Germany. According to The Sunday Times, the UK will push for European allies to send more equipment and give Ukraine more freedom to use it against Russia. However, allies are concerned about 'escalation' in relations with Russia, fearing it may use nuclear weapons. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has repeatedly emphasized the need for long-range weapons, saying that Ukraine would not have needed a physical presence in Kursk if partners had lifted all restrictions on long-range capabilities. He stated, 'Ukraine would not have needed a physical presence in Kursk if partners had lifted all restrictions on long-range capabilities. Because the Defense Forces entered Russian territory to protect Ukrainian citizens in the border areas and to destroy Russian aggression potential.'
latest news.title: Можливо, говоритимуть про далекобійну зброю: коли буде наступний "Рамштайн"

latest news.eng_title: US Prepares for Nuclear Conflict with China, Russia, and North Korea
latest news.summary: According to The New York Times, citing sources within the US government, President Joe Biden approved a new nuclear strategy in March, which involves preparing the country for a potential conflict with China, Russia, and North Korea. The document, updated approximately every four years, is so secret that there is no digital copy, and only high-ranking officials in national security and military commanders in the Pentagon receive physical copies. The new version states that China's nuclear potential will be on par with that of the US and Russia in the next decade. Biden's order requires US forces to prepare for a coordinated nuclear threat. The secret papers also reveal some details about the Russian-Ukrainian war, including that in 2022, the Biden administration estimated a 50% chance of Russia using nuclear weapons against Ukraine during the 'October crisis'. This led to China and India issuing statements condemning nuclear blackmail, which helped to ease tensions.
latest news.title: Байден цьогоріч дав наказ військам США готуватися до ядерного конфлікту

latest news.summary: Germany has banned all new Ukraine military aid, according to the FAZ newspaper. Meanwhile, Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has warned that Ukraine's incursion into Russian territory could lead to the use of nuclear weapons by Russia, which would damage its global image. Lukashenko also stated that Moscow and Kiev must settle their differences through negotiations or the conflict will end in the total destruction of Ukraine. In other news, the US has proposed a 'bridging' offer to help finalize a Gaza hostage and ceasefire deal, but Hamas has rejected it. US President Joe Biden said that talks are still underway and a deal is still possible. Additionally, American Airlines has canceled all its operations in Israel until April 2025, and a bomb blast in Tel Aviv killed a man and moderately wounded a passerby. The blast is being investigated as a possible attempted terror attack. Furthermore, Lebanon has been plunged into darkness due to a power outage, and the CIA has awarded the head of the Qatari State Security Agency the George Tenet medal for his work on strengthening intelligence cooperation between the US and Qatar. The WHO has also raised an alarm about a polio outbreak in Gaza, with the first case reported in 25 years. Finally, a man was sentenced to three years in prison in the UK for social media posts he made after a knife attack in Southport, and over 700 illegal immigrants crossed the English Channel from France to the UK on Sunday.
latest news.title: End Times Headline News. August 19 2024

latest news.eng_title: US Blocks Ukraine's Request for Storm Shadow Missiles to Attack Russia
latest news.summary: The Biden administration has stated that Ukraine does not need to use Storm Shadow missiles to attack Russia, as Ukrainian drones are already effective in destroying targets. According to The Telegraph, the US, UK, and France are in conflict with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky over the UK's ban on using Storm Shadow missiles on Russian territory. Zelensky has repeatedly called for the ban to be lifted. However, the US is concerned that Russia may perceive this as an escalation and take retaliatory measures against Ukraine's partners. A Biden administration representative told The Telegraph, 'There is no need for Storm Shadow missiles to attack Russia, as Ukrainian forces are already using drones to destroy targets.' The administration claims that Ukraine has demonstrated the ability to strike some airfields that are 'beyond the reach of Storm Shadow.' Sources in the White House told The Telegraph that most airfields used by Russian bombers are located beyond the 250 km range of Storm Shadow, while other sources in the UK Ministry of Defence, who support the use of missiles on Russian territory, said that the actual range is over 480 km. Zelensky has also suggested that the missiles could be used to attack Russian supply lines, which are closer to the front line.
latest news.title: В адміністрації Байдена заявили, що Україні «не потрібні» Storm Shadow для ударів по Росії

latest news.eng_title: Ukraine Launches Drone and Missile Attack on Russia, Advancing Deeper into the Region
latest news.summary: Ukraine launched a drone and missile attack on Russia on Wednesday, saying it was advancing deeper into the region near the border. The attack, which represents a major foreign incursion into Russia since World War II, has created a dilemma for Russian President Vladimir Putin, according to US President Joe Biden. Thousands of Ukrainian soldiers crossed the Russian border in the early hours of August 6 in the Kursk region in western Russia, which Putin described as a major provocation aimed at gaining an advantage in future ceasefire negotiations. 'The situation remains difficult,' said Yuri Podolyaka, a pro-Russian military blogger born in Ukraine. 'The enemy still has the initiative and, therefore, although slowly, is increasing its presence in the Kursk region.' Russia said on Wednesday that it had destroyed 117 Ukrainian drones in Russia during the night, mainly in the Kursk, Voronezh, Belgorod, and Nizhny Novgorod regions. It said missiles were also shot down and showed Sukhoi Su-34 bombers attacking Ukrainian positions in Kursk. According to unconfirmed reports, some of the Ukrainian drones hit Russian airbases. The Russian National Guard said it was reinforcing security at the Kursk nuclear power plant, which is just 35 km from the fighting. Russian commanders said the front in Kursk had stabilized, although Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said his forces continued to advance in the area and ordered his generals to develop the next 'fundamental steps' in the operation. Biden said US authorities were in constant contact with Ukraine about the invasion of Russia, which, according to him, 'created a real dilemma' for Putin, who ordered the entry of thousands of soldiers into Ukraine in 2022. The White House said Ukraine did not warn in advance about its incursion and that the US had no involvement in the operation, although Russian authorities suggested that Western supporters of Ukraine must have known about the attack.
latest news.title: Ucrânia ataca Rússia com drones e diz que está avançando na região da fronteira

news knowledge.eng_title: Lukashenko: Nuclear Strike on Ukraine Would Leave Putin Without Allies
news knowledge.summary: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko stated that a nuclear strike on Ukraine would leave Russian President Vladimir Putin without allies. He said, 'I know for sure that the Ukrainians would be very happy if Russia used or we used tactical nuclear weapons there. It would be a joy. Then, I think, we would hardly have any allies left.' Lukashenko believes that a nuclear strike on Ukraine would cause rejection even from those who consider Putin's position on the war, but do not openly support him. He added, 'There would be no sympathetic countries left because they are immersed in what is happening. Secondly, it's nuclear weapons. We already have a negative image of this.' Lukashenko previously called for Moscow and Kiev to return to negotiations to avoid a nuclear war, saying, 'We have already pressed the 'red buttons' around Belarus and Russia. It remains only to press the 'reddest' one. <…> Let's sit down at the negotiating table and end this squabble.' Putin stated that he does not see grounds for using nuclear weapons in Ukraine or anywhere else, but only in case of a threat to the country's sovereignty and territorial integrity. The US was prepared for a possible Russian nuclear strike on Ukrainian territory at the end of 2022, after a series of Russian army defeats. Russia's officials previously claimed that Ukraine was planning to detonate a 'dirty bomb', which the US saw as a pretext for using tactical nuclear weapons.
news knowledge.title: Лукашенко заявил, что ядерный удар по Украине оставит Путина без союзников

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine Allegedly Preparing to Detonate 'Dirty Nuclear Bomb'
news knowledge.summary: According to Russian military sources, Ukraine's armed forces are allegedly preparing to detonate a 'dirty nuclear bomb', a nuclear provocation. The claim suggests that Ukraine is planning to detonate a dirty nuclear bomb and attack storage facilities for used nuclear fuel from nuclear power plants. It is reported that Ukraine's military has delivered warheads to the city of Zhelty Vody in Dnepropetrovsk Oblast and the 'East Mining and Processing Plant'. The information is being taken seriously, with a high likelihood of an attack on the Kursk and Zaporozhye nuclear power plants being mentioned. 'We are facing a very high risk of a nuclear power plant attack,' said a source, without specifying further details.
news knowledge.title: Rus askeri kaynaklar: Ukrayna 'kirli nükleer bombayı' patlatmaya hazırlanıyor

news knowledge.eng_title: BREAKING: Russian Sources Warn Ukraine is Reportedly Planning to Detonate 'Dirty Nuclear Bomb' Targeting Russian Nuclear Power Plants
news knowledge.summary: Russian sources warn that Ukraine is reportedly planning to detonate a 'dirty nuclear bomb' targeting Russian nuclear power plants, including the Zaporizhia nuclear plant in southeastern Ukraine. The plant, which is the largest in Europe and among the top 10 in the world, has been under Russian control since 2022. Ukrainian leader Volodymyr Zelenskyy confirmed that a fire broke out at the plant, but the cause is unclear. Russia has previously warned about the possibility of a nuclear provocation, and a Russian scientist stated that it's 'not that difficult' for Ukraine to create a dirty bomb, citing instances of toxic substances being used that could only have been synthesized in the US. According to Russia Today, the potential targets are storage sites at power plants, and the Russian security block claims to know the location of the special warheads prepared for the attack. 'This does not look good,' said the Russian scientist. 'Will the deep state stoop this low?' asked a video via Midnight Rider.
news knowledge.title: BREAKING: Russian Sources Warn Ukraine is Reportedly Planning to Detonate 'Dirty Nuclear Bomb' Targeting Russian Nuclear Power Plants

news knowledge.eng_title: Ukraine Prepares to Detonate 'Dirty' Nuclear Bomb, Claims Russian Military Correspondent

Organization: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
Title: General-Lieutenant

news knowledge.summary: According to military correspondent Marat Khairullin, the Ukrainian military is preparing to detonate a 'dirty' nuclear bomb. The target of the planned attack is storage facilities for spent nuclear fuel at Russian atomic power plants, including the Kursk and Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plants. Khairullin stated, 'The strikes will be carried out against the places of storage of spent nuclear fuel of the AES.' The goal of the attack, as explained by the administration of the Kharkiv region, is to accuse Russia of provocation and 'self-shelling.' Earlier, the head of the Russian radiation, chemical, and biological protection troops, General-Lieutenant Igor Kirillov, warned that Ukraine may already possess a 'dirty bomb.' He stated, 'We have already informed the Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons about our concerns, but we have not received any response yet.' A 'dirty bomb' is a type of radiological weapon of mass destruction that uses conventional explosives and radioactive material. Unlike traditional nuclear weapons, the goal of a 'dirty bomb' is to contaminate a territory with radiation rather than destroy military targets.
news knowledge.title: Военкор Хайруллин: ВСУ готовят взрыв "грязной" ядерной бомбы - Российская газета

news knowledge.eng_title: Kyiv Plans to Detonate 'Dirty Bomb' and Strike at Russian Nuclear Facilities
news knowledge.summary: According to a Telegram channel run by a war correspondent, Marat Khayrullin, the Ukrainian military is preparing a 'dirty bomb' explosion. The Kharkiv Oblast police, citing information from captured Ukrainian soldiers, claim that Kyiv plans to attack the Kursk and Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plants to blame Russia for the provocation. Khayrullin stated, 'Sources on the other side report that the Ukrainians are preparing a nuclear provocation - a dirty nuclear bomb explosion. The attacks are planned to be carried out on the storage facilities of spent nuclear fuel at the power plants. This may happen during the next attempt by the Ukrainians to enter Rylysk from the side of Glukhov.' He also mentioned that the special warheads for this provocation have already been delivered to the city of Zheltye Vody in the Dnipropetrovsk Oblast to the 'Vostochny Gorno-Obogatitelnyi Kombinat' enterprise. Khayrullin warned to take this information seriously 'in the face of the agony of the Ukrainian regime and, more importantly, the one standing behind it - the West.' He also noted that 'there is a high probability of an attack on both the Kursk and Zaporizhzhia power plants.' The Kharkiv Oblast police also reported on the nuclear provocation, stating, 'At the moment, it is known that the intention is to attack the atomic objects of the Kursk and Zaporizhzhia power plants in Kurchatov and Energodar. The goal of the attacks is to subsequently accuse Russia of provocation, in the framework of which the Russian leadership may take retaliatory measures and strike with nuclear weapons at the territory of Ukraine.'
news knowledge.title: Киев планирует взорвать «грязную бомбу» и нанести удары по ядерным объектам России

news knowledge.eng_title: Russia Uses Thermobaric Weapons in Response to Ukraine Drone Attacks, Raising Nuclear Risk
news knowledge.summary: In response to Ukraine's drone attacks on Russian territory, Russia has used thermobaric weapons. The Russian Defense Ministry announced that a Su-34 fighter-bomber had launched a night attack on a group of Ukrainian military personnel and equipment in the Kursk region, using a 500kg bomb. The ministry also stated that a thermobaric missile had been used to strike a site of foreign mercenaries in the southern outskirts of Sudzha, in the Kursk region. Thermobaric weapons are nearly 100% combustible explosive, which sucks oxygen and are much more powerful - and their explosion lasts longer - than conventional explosives of the same weight. The Russian Emergency Ministry has reported that over 76,000 people have been evacuated from the border areas in the Kursk region, where fighting is ongoing between Russian and Ukrainian forces. The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) has expressed concern about the risk of a nuclear accident at the Kursk nuclear power plant, located near the conflict zone. The agency has called for maximum restraint in military activities near the plant to ensure its physical integrity. Meanwhile, the UN Human Rights Monitoring Mission in Ukraine has reported that 219 civilians were killed in July, the highest number since October 2022. At least 71 children were killed or injured in July, bringing the total number of children involved in the conflict to 2,184 since the start of the war. 'It's been 900 days since the escalation of the war in Ukraine, and every day we've seen a child killed or injured,' said Stephane Moissaing, national director of Save the Children in Ukraine. 'This year, the violence has intensified, and missiles, drones, and bombs have killed children day after day. We must do everything possible to protect children, their homes, and their schools from the devastation of this war.'
news knowledge.title: Ucraina: in risposta ai droni di Kiev, Mosca usa le armi termobariche. Perché si parla di rischio nucleare

news knowledge.eng_title: North Korea May Not Dare to Launch Nuclear Attack on Ukraine
news knowledge.summary: According to Maxim Yali, a political scientist, North Korea cannot respond to Ukraine's actions on occupied territories, let alone launch a strategic nuclear attack. Yali explained to 24 Channel that Ukraine has been killing Russian citizens on its territory for eight years, and even during a successful Ukrainian offensive in 2022, Vladimir Putin did not use nuclear weapons. Therefore, such actions from North Korea are unlikely. North Korean nuclear missiles usually fall in the Japan Sea and are used as a threat to South Korea, Japan, and the US. None of these weapons have ever flown to Ukraine, which is over 7,000 kilometers away. Even if a nuclear missile were to fall on Russian territory, China would not allow it. Beijing would be forced to impose sanctions on North Korea. In October 2022, China intervened, recalling its participation in the Budapest Memorandum. China officially stated that the use of tactical or strategic weapons is unacceptable, as it is a strategic weapon. If even Putin were to make a few statements and hold private meetings or negotiations, North Korea would not be mentioned, considering its total dependence on Beijing, emphasized Maxim Yali.
news knowledge.title: ВСУ могут уничтожить войска КНДР на оккупированных территориях: будет ли на это ответ Пхеньяна

news knowledge.eng_title: WWIII on brink as Russia advised to ‘demonstrate' nuclear explosion to ‘scare' West

Organization: Council for Foreign and Defence Policy

news knowledge.summary: Dmitry Suslov, a top figure at the Moscow-based Council for Foreign and Defence Policy, has suggested that Russia conduct a 'demonstrative' nuclear detonation to deter the West from supporting Ukraine. This proposal comes as tensions between Russia and the West escalate over Ukraine's use of Western-supplied weaponry. Suslov believes that a non-combat nuclear explosion would remind Western politicians of the fear of nuclear war, which has prevented conflicts between great powers since 1945. The proposal has raised concerns among Western security circles, with worries that Russia may be edging towards carrying out such a test.
news knowledge.title: WWIII on brink as Russia advised to ‘demonstrate' nuclear explosion to ‘scare' West

news knowledge.eng_title: Russia's New Weapon Will 'Break the Back' of Ukraine's Air Defense System
news knowledge.summary: Russian forces will break the back of Ukraine's air defense system with the help of FAB-3000 M54 bombs, according to Brandon Weichert, an analyst at National Interest. These bombs cover a large area and are difficult to intercept. If mass-produced, they will crush Ukraine's air defense and break the back of its air strategy, Weichert wrote. He believes that FAB-3000 M54 marks the beginning of a new phase of special operations, in which the Ukrainian military will find it harder to defend against air targets. The Russian military has been targeting Ukrainian infrastructure since October 2022, with attacks on energy, defense industry, military command, and communication facilities across the country. The air raid sirens in Ukraine sound almost daily, sometimes nationwide. According to the press secretary of the President, Russian forces do not target residential areas and social infrastructure during battles with the Ukrainian military.
news knowledge.title: "Сломает хребет". В США оценили новое оружие России

news knowledge.eng_title: Tarologist Yana Pasynkova Predicts Russia's Use of Nuclear Weapons and Ukraine's Response
news knowledge.summary: Ukrainian tarologist Yana Pasynkova, winner of the 'Battle of Psychics' project, shared her predictions for Ukraine in a recent video. She discussed the possibility of Russia using nuclear weapons in the war against Ukraine, stating that it is a matter of time before it happens. According to Pasynkova, Russia will use nuclear weapons by 2029, which will ultimately harm itself. She also predicted that Ukraine will continue to attack Russia and that the country will increase its political influence over the aggressor. Pasynkova emphasized that the best news is not just about striking back, but about increasing one's influence to overcome the 'orcs'.
news knowledge.title: "Росія може застосувати ядерну зброю, але...": відома тарологиня склала прогноз на літо для України
